title: How to Leave a Group in Need for Speed World

methods.name: Leaving a Group via the Social Screen

steps.headline: Launch Need for Speed World.
steps.description: You can launch the game from the Start menu or desktop, if you created a shortcut there during setup.

steps.headline: Log into your account.
steps.description:
Enter your username and password into the fields provided, and click “Sign in.”
After logging in, NFSW will initiate an update. As soon as NFSW has finished downloading and installing all the required updates from the Internet, a dialog box with a “Play” button will appear.

steps.headline: Enter the NFSW world in Free Roam mode.
steps.description: Click on the “Play” button, and press “Enter” or any other key to start. This will load and display your NFSW profile details. Click “Enter World” to enter the NFS World in Free Roam mode. Free Roam is a mode in the game (and most other modern NFS titles) that allows you to tour the racing world to find races or other drivers.

steps.headline: Hit “O” on your keyboard.
steps.description: This will launch NFS World’s Social screen.

steps.headline: Click on the Group List icon on the Social screen.
steps.description: It is the third icon from the left at the top of the screen; if you hover your mouse over the icon, it will say “Group List.” This will open the Group tab, which lists all the members in the group.

steps.headline: Leave the group.
steps.description: Click the “Leave Group” button at the bottom of the screen. This is the button next to the “+” icon. Click “Yes” on the dialog box that appears to confirm the action. This will immediately remove you from the group.

steps.headline: Confirm that you’re no longer in the group.
steps.description: This is optional, but if you really want to check that you’ve been removed from the group, open the Social screen again and access the Group List tab. If you are not in a group, a notification will appear on Group List tab indicating so; otherwise, the other Drivers that are in the group will be listed.

methods.name: Leaving a Group by Exiting the Game

steps.headline: Exit NFSW using the Exit command.
steps.description: During Free Roam, press Escape on your keyboard. This will bring up the Options menu. On the Options menu, click the very last item: “Exit Game.” This will close the game, removing you from the group.

steps.headline: Exit NFSW using the Alt+F4 shortcut.
steps.description: Press the Alt key together with F4 whilst in any part of NFSW. This will instantly close the game, and thus remove you from the group.

steps.headline: Exit NFSW by first returning to Windows.
steps.description: Press the Windows key on your keyboard whilst in any part of the game. This will minimize NFSW and return you to the Windows desktop. Right-click the icon of the minimized NFSW on the taskbar, and select “Close.” This will close NFSW and remove you from the group. Whichever way you exit NFSW, when you log in again and return to the game, you will no longer be in a group.

Leaving a Group via the Social Screen Launch Need for Speed World. You can launch the game from the Start menu or desktop, if you created a shortcut there during setup. Log into your account. Enter your username and password into the fields provided, and click “Sign in.”
After logging in, NFSW will initiate an update. As soon as NFSW has finished downloading and installing all the required updates from the Internet, a dialog box with a “Play” button will appear. Enter the NFSW world in Free Roam mode. Click on the “Play” button, and press “Enter” or any other key to start. This will load and display your NFSW profile details. Click “Enter World” to enter the NFS World in Free Roam mode. Free Roam is a mode in the game (and most other modern NFS titles) that allows you to tour the racing world to find races or other drivers. Hit “O” on your keyboard. This will launch NFS World’s Social screen. Click on the Group List icon on the Social screen. It is the third icon from the left at the top of the screen; if you hover your mouse over the icon, it will say “Group List.” This will open the Group tab, which lists all the members in the group. Leave the group. Click the “Leave Group” button at the bottom of the screen. This is the button next to the “+” icon. Click “Yes” on the dialog box that appears to confirm the action. This will immediately remove you from the group. Confirm that you’re no longer in the group. This is optional, but if you really want to check that you’ve been removed from the group, open the Social screen again and access the Group List tab. If you are not in a group, a notification will appear on Group List tab indicating so; otherwise, the other Drivers that are in the group will be listed. Leaving a Group by Exiting the Game Exit NFSW using the Exit command. During Free Roam, press Escape on your keyboard. This will bring up the Options menu. On the Options menu, click the very last item: “Exit Game.” This will close the game, removing you from the group. Exit NFSW using the Alt+F4 shortcut. Press the Alt key together with F4 whilst in any part of NFSW. This will instantly close the game, and thus remove you from the group. Exit NFSW by first returning to Windows. Press the Windows key on your keyboard whilst in any part of the game. This will minimize NFSW and return you to the Windows desktop. Right-click the icon of the minimized NFSW on the taskbar, and select “Close.” This will close NFSW and remove you from the group. Whichever way you exit NFSW, when you log in again and return to the game, you will no longer be in a group.
